revised_title: Catalytic Isomerization of Buten-1: A Study on Double-Bond Migration and Hydrogenation
tldr: The authors studied the catalytic isomerization of buten-1 using a nickel catalyst and hydrogen. They discovered that the rate of double-bond migration and hydrogenation were both proportional to the square root of the butene pressure and the square root of the hydrogen pressure. This research supports the theory that the catalytic exchange between olefins and deuterium occurs through the formation of an associative complex.
